content.description: An agency that hires out clerical workers claims its workers can type, on average, at least 60 words per minute (<math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>). To test the claim, a random sample of 50 workers from the agency were given a typing test, and the average typing speed was 58.8 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test was conducted to investigate whether there is evidence that the mean typing speed of workers from the agency is less than 60 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The resulting <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value was 0.267.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: The probability is 0.267 that the mean typing speed is 60 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or more for workers from the agency.

The probability is 0.267 that the mean typing speed is 60 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or less for workers from the agency.

The probability is 0.267 that the mean typing speed is 58.8 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or less for workers from the agency.

If the mean typing speed of workers from the agency is 60 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></math>, the probability of selecting a sample of 50 workers with mean 58.8 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or less is 0.267.

If the mean typing speed of workers from the agency is less than 60 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></math>, the probability of selecting a sample of 50 workers with mean 58.8 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or less is 0.267.

content.answer: If the mean typing speed of workers from the agency is 60 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></math>, the probability of selecting a sample of 50 workers with mean 58.8 <math alttext="words per minute" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>wpm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or less is 0.267.

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
